alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 09 at 4:21PM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and northern Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Coastal Duval, Coastal Flagler, Coastal Nassau, Coastal St. Johns, Eastern Clay, Eastern Putnam, Inland Flagler, Inland Nassau, Inland St. Johns, South Central Duval, Trout River, Western Clay, Western Duval and Western Putnam. In northern Florida, Central Marion and Eastern Marion. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for portions of northeast Florida. Heavy rainfall of up to 3 to 5 inches is forecast with localy heavy amounts, which may lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
